title: Nez Perce National Historical Park: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit      Where is the Information that I Need? Pre-planning is important. Most of the basic information you will need is available on this website. Start with a copy of the visitor guide. We have directions, operating hours and things to do as well as other information you need to plan an exciting trip.   Thirty-Eight Sites in Four States Nez Perce National Historical Park has thirty-eight sites spread across Idaho, Montana, Oregon and Washington. It takes some planning to experience this story. Visit these sites to determine what your schedule will allow. Lodging and Camping Nez Perce National Historical Park has thirty-eight sites spread over four states (Idaho, Montana, Oregon and Washington). The park does not operate any lodges or campgrounds. You can find information, though, on the visitor bureau websites for Idaho, Montana, Oregon, and Washington:  Idaho (North Central Idaho Travel Association) Montana (Montana Office of Tourism) Oregon (Travel Oregon) Washington (Washington Tourism Alliance) Outdoor Activities The park has several short hiking trails in several of the park's larger sites. Other outdoor activities are available in neighboring towns and public lands. The links above can help you find those opportunities. Things to Know Before You Come Learn how to get around, what weather to expect, what to do with your pet, and what's available in nearby communities.
